title: Stream: Mind Not The Timid – Beacons
content:
For a band that rarely find time to practice together, let alone make it to the studio, Nashville ten piece (yes, TEN), Mind Not The Timid have a startling synergy.

Not only that, but with the average age of the band members sitting somewhere around the mid-teens, they’re shockingly ambitious. Their hugely accomplished debut album of demos, titled Beacons, MNTT, marshalled by lead singer and chief songwriter, Brady Heyen, marks them out as one of the most exciting prospects in indie music. From stunning instrumental interludes (Burial, Mosamor) to epic moments of Arcade Fire inspired euphoria (Flood, Joy, Man From Illinois), it’s bold, hard-hitting, and above all, hugely enjoyable. Check out the full album below, and pick it up on a name your price deal over at their Bandcamp, also keep your eyes peeled for an interview with MNTT, online over the next couple of days.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
